newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Citizens sets up $100 mln onshore fund.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Citizens sets up $100 mln onshore fund.

text.p: South Korea's Citizens Investment Trust Management and Securities Co Ltd has set up a $100 million onshore fund for foreigners to invest on the Seoul stock market, a company spokesman said on Thursday.
Citizens Investment, a major domestic institutional investor, designated Hyundai Securities as a lead-manager of the fund named CITC Seoul Dynasty Trust.
Chohung Bank was named as a custodian, the spokesman said. The spokesman said payment of the fund would be closed on May 30 and the fund would begin buying stocks soon after the payment.
Hyundai Group currently holds a 44.52 percent stake of Citizens Investment, which had expanded its business into securities and merchant banking.
